body:
So if I'm understanding you correctly you'd set up a b2 remote as normal, but download objects from a different URL rather than from b2 directly - is that right?

That sounds easy enough to implement.

Do you want to have a go?

Yeah.

To provide more information on it. Below is the link i followed to create a cloudflare cdn url for my B2 bucket
https://help.backblaze.com/hc/en-us/articles/217666928-Using-Backblaze-B2-with-the-Cloudflare-CDN

I will be using it to access/download files without any bandwidth charges :)
Do you want to have a go at implementing it?

What you need to do is make a new option say "download_url"

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/107293c80e2e55e8abb024a9610c2a456f027046/backend/b2/b2.go#L114

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/107293c80e2e55e8abb024a9610c2a456f027046/backend/b2/b2.go#L127

 and use it here


https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/107293c80e2e55e8abb024a9610c2a456f027046/backend/b2/b2.go#L1274

Let me know if you need more help than that

issue.title: b2: allow manual configuration of backblaze downloadUrl - fixes #2808

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Backblaze introduced free egress for B2 Cloud Storage when files are [downloaded through the Cloudflare network](https://www.backblaze.com/blog/backblaze-and-cloudflare-partner-to-provide-free-data-transfer/). This requires using a custom url or endpoint for downloads instead of the `downloadUrl` provided by `b2_authorize_account`.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2808

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: I've merged a fix for this (thanks @trettet ) to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.47

issue.title: cloudflare download url error with b2

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
rclone copy through cloudflare url for backblaze is not working


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone-v1.52.2-276-gc2f3949d-beta-linux-amd64

rclone v1.52.2
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
linux


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
backblaze b2


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -vv copy bb:BUCKET_NAME/100mb /tmp/


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2020/07/31 15:11:51 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "copy" "bb:BUCKET_NAME/100mb" "/tmp/"]
2020/07/31 15:11:52 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2020/07/31 15:11:54 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "bb:BUCKET_NAME/100mb" to be canonical "bb:BUCKET_NAME"
2020/07/31 15:11:54 DEBUG : 100mb: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2020/07/31 15:11:54 DEBUG : Couldn't decode error response: invalid character 'e' looking for beginning of value
2020/07/31 15:11:54 ERROR : 100mb: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: failed to open for download: Unknown 403 Forbidden (403 unknown)
2020/07/31 15:11:54 ERROR : Fatal error received - not attempting retries
2020/07/31 15:11:54 INFO  :
Transferred:             0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Errors:                 1 (fatal error encountered)
Elapsed time:         0.0s

#### My rclone config
[bb]
type = b2
account = xxxx
key = xxxx
download_url = https://CNAME.DOMAIN.COM/file/BUCKET_NAME/

I am using master key.
I have used all combinations of download_url but none are working and giving the same error.

https://CNAME.DOMAIN.COM/
https://CNAME.DOMAIN.COM/file/
https://CNAME.DOMAIN.COM/file/BUCKET_NAME/
